parse.title: List of disasters in New Zealand by death toll

text.*:
This is a list of New Zealand disasters by death toll, listing major disasters (excluding acts of war) which occurred in New Zealand and its territories or involved a significant number of New Zealand citizens, in a specific incident, where the loss of life was 10 or more.

Contents

  • 1 100 or more deaths
  • 2 50 to 99 deaths
  • 3 10 to 49 deaths
  • 4 Pandemics and health crises
  • 5 Significant incidents of New Zealanders being killed overseas
  • 6 See also
  • 7 References
  • 8 External links

100 or more deaths[edit]

  • Remnants of Flight 901 fuselage, 2005

  • Hastings Post Office after the 1931 Hawke's Bay earthquake

  • Orepuki, Southland

  • Wreck of the HMS Orpheus

  • Most victims of the February 2011 Christchurch earthquake died in the CTV Building's collapse

  • Tangiwai wreckage

  • Wreck of the Tararua

  • Wreck of the SS Wairarapa

  • Inside the fissure formed in Tarawera's 1886 eruption

Deaths Name or description Type Date Location Notes
7002257000000000000♠257 Air New Zealand Flight TE901 Air accident 28 Nov 1979 Mt Erebus, Ross Dependency, Antarctica Controlled flight into terrain
7002256000000000000♠256[1][2] 1931 Hawke's Bay earthquake earthquake 3 Feb 1931 20 km north of Napier
7002200000000000000♠200+ 1820s Southland tsunami tsunami 1820s Orepuki Beach exact number killed unknown but according to Maori oral histories greater than 200
7002189000000000000♠189 HMS Orpheus shipwreck 7 Feb 1863 off the Manukau Heads near Auckland
7002185000000000000♠185[3] 2011 Christchurch earthquake earthquake 22 February 2011 Christchurch
7002151000000000000♠151 Tangiwai disaster rail accident / lahar 24 Dec 1953 NIMT Whangaehu River bridge, between Waiouru and Ohakune rail bridge destroyed by lahar from Mount Ruapehu
7002135000000000000♠135+[4] 1st Little Waihi landslide landslide 1780 Te Rapa/Waihi Village
7002131000000000000♠131 SS Tararua shipwreck 29 Apr 1881 off Waipapa Point
7002121000000000000♠121 SS Wairarapa shipwreck 29 Oct 1894 off Great Barrier Island
7002108000000000000♠108–153[5][6] Mount Tarawera eruption volcanic eruption 10 Jun 1886 Mount Tarawera The exact deathtoll ranges between 153, estimated at the time, and 108 based on more recent research

50 to 99 deaths[edit]

  • Clipper ship Fiery Star

  • SS Penguin

  • Wreck of the General Grant

  • Burial of victims of the Brunner Mine disaster

  • Salvage operations on the wreck of TEV Wahine

  • Cape Terawhiti where the City of Dunedin sank

Deaths Name or description Type Date Location Notes
7001870000000000000♠87 Fiery Star shipwreck 11 May 1865 240 km off the Chatham Islands
7001750000000000000♠75 SS Penguin shipwreck 12 Feb 1909 off Cape Terawhiti
7001680000000000000♠68[7] General Grant shipwreck May 1866 Auckland Island
7001650000000000000♠65[8] Brunner Mine disaster mine accident 26 Mar 1896 Brunner
7001650000000000000♠65[9] 2nd Little Waihi Landslide landslide 7 May 1846 Waihi Village Tribal leader Mananui Te Heuheu Tukino II and most of his family were killed in the landslide[10]
7001530000000000000♠53[11] TEV Wahine shipwreck 10 Apr 1968 Barrett Reef, Wellington Harbour
7001520000000000000♠52 City of Dunedin shipwreck 20 May 1865 off Cape Terawhiti There are estimates of between 250 and 600 passengers perishing, but these reports were 20 or more years later
7001510000000000000♠51+ Blizzard and Flood of 1863 floods and blizzards Jul 1863 - Aug 1863 Central Otago goldfields The actual death toll was probably higher because of the transient nature of the miners and the ruggedness of the country

10 to 49 deaths[edit]

  • SS Elingamite

  • Ralph Mine disaster

  • Ballantyne's fire seen from ChristChurch Cathedral

  • Seacliff asylum, before the fire

  • Kaitangata Mine disaster memorial

  • SS Dunedin

  • SS Marlborough

  • MV Kaitawa

  • MV Joyita

  • SS Assaye

  • NAC flight 441 memorial

  • Hyde railway disaster memorial

  • Strongman Mine disaster memorial

  • The Ongarue railway disaster

  • Restored grave of Dundonald's mate, Auckland Islands

  • Octagon building fire

  • Remains of sulphur mine, White Island

Deaths Name or description Type Date Location Notes
7001480000000000000♠48 Featherston Prisoner of war camp riot Riot 25 Feb 1943 Featherston, New Zealand
7001450000000000000♠45 SS Elingamite shipwreck 9 Nov 1902 off West Island in the Three Kings Islands
7001430000000000000♠43[12] Ralph's Mine mine accident 12 Sep 1914 Huntly
7001410000000000000♠41 Ballantyne's store disaster fire 18 Nov 1947 Christchurch
7001400000000000000♠40+[13][14] Great storm of 1868, flash floods and 12 shipwrecks storm 3 Feb 1868 Predominantly eastern areas of New Zealand Death toll likely understated as impact on many Maori unknown
7001370000000000000♠37 Seacliff Lunatic Asylum fire 8 Dec 1942 Seacliff
7001340000000000000♠34[13][15] SS Taiaroa shipwreck 11 Apr 1886 Clarence River mouth
7001340000000000000♠34 Kaitangata Mine disaster mine explosion 21 Feb 1879 Kaitangata
7001340000000000000♠34[16] Dunedin shipwreck (presumed) 1890 between Oamaru and London
7001300000000000000♠30 Marlborough shipwreck (presumed) 1890 between Lyttelton and London
7001290000000000000♠29[17] Pike River Mine disaster mine explosion 19 November 2010 northwest of Greymouth
7001290000000000000♠29[18] MV Kaitawa shipwreck 23 May 1966 near Pandora Bank, Cape Reinga
7001260000000000000♠26 Barque Maria shipwreck[15] 1851 Cape Terawhiti
7001250000000000000♠25+[19][20] Storm of 1897 floods and shipwreck 16 Apr 1897 North Island flooding at Clive, boating accidents, and the wreck of the Zuleika near Cape Palliser. 25 confirmed deaths and 6 unconfirmed
7001250000000000000♠25[21][22] MV Joyita ghost ship Oct 1955 En route from Apia, Samoa to Tokelau
7001240000000000000♠24[23] Assaye shipwreck (presumed) 1890 between London and Wellington; wreckage washed up at the Chatham Islands 7 months after the ship left London
7001230000000000000♠23 New Zealand National Airways Corporation Flight 441 air accident 3 Jul 1963 Kaimai Ranges
7001220000000000000♠22[24] launch Ranui shipwreck 30 Dec 1950 off Mount Maunganui, Bay of Plenty
7001210000000000000♠21 Hyde railway disaster rail accident 4 Jun 1943 near Hyde
7001210000000000000♠21[25] Kopuawhara flash flood of 1938 flood 19 Feb 1938 Destroyed the Kopuawhara railway workers camp
7001210000000000000♠21[26][27] brigantine Sophia Pate shipwreck Aug 1841 Kaipara Harbour
7001200000000000000♠20[15] schooner St. Vincent shipwreck 1869 Palliser Bay
7001190000000000000♠19[28] Strongman Mine mine explosion 19 Jan 1967 near Greymouth
7001180000000000000♠18[29] Canoe on Lake Rotorua boating accident 16 Apr 1870 near Mokia Island on Lake Rotorua
7001180000000000000♠18[30] Canoe on Motu River boating accident 4 Aug 1900 Motu River - 25 miles from Opotiki[31] There were 16 children and 2 adults in the six person canoe
7001180000000000000♠18[32] Clyde shipwreck 6 Nov 1884 Horseshoe Bay, near Akaroa, Banks Peninsula
7001180000000000000♠18[33] Lastingham shipwreck 1 Sep 1884 Cape Jackson, Cook Strait
7001180000000000000♠18[34] schooners Enterprise and Tauranga shipwreck 23 Jul 1870 between Cape Rodney and Sail Rock, Hauraki Gulf
7001170000000000000♠17[35] 1929 Murchison earthquake earthquake 17 Jun 1929 Murchison
7001170000000000000♠17 Ongarue railway disaster rail accident[13] 6 Jul 1923 Ongarue
7001160000000000000♠16[36] Capitaine Bougainville shipwreck 3 Sep 1975 Whananaki
7001160000000000000♠16[37] 1943 Liberator crash at Whenuapai air accident 2 Aug 1943 Whenuapai Those killed were mainly Japanese civilians who were being repatriated in a prisoner exchange.
7001150000000000000♠15[38] Brynderwyns bus accident road accident 7 Feb 1963 Brynderwyn Hills
7001150000000000000♠15[39] MV Holmglen shipwreck 24 Nov 1959 near Timaru
7001150000000000000♠15[13] Lockheed Lodestar airliner crash air accident 18 Mar 1949 near Waikanae
7001150000000000000♠15[40] Derry Castle shipwreck 20 Mar 1887 Enderby Island, Auckland Islands
7001140000000000000♠14 Cave Creek disaster structural failure 28 Apr 1995 Paparoa National Park
7001140000000000000♠14[41] Aramoana massacre spree killing 13 Nov 1990 Aramoana, near Dunedin
7001140000000000000♠14[42] Two Hudson bombers lost off the New Zealand coast air accident 21 Aug 1944 en route from Fiji No. 4 Squadron RNZAF
7001140000000000000♠14[43] floods 17 Jan 1858 Hutt Valley
7001130000000000000♠13 NAC Electra air crash air accident 23 Oct 1948 on Mount Ruapehu
7001130000000000000♠13[44] SS Ventnor shipwreck 28 Oct 1902 off Omapere, Hokianga
7001130000000000000♠13[15] Tasmania shipwreck 1897 Mahia Peninsula
7001120000000000000♠12[45] barque Dundonald shipwreck 7 Mar 1907 Disappointment Island, Auckland Islands
7001120000000000000♠12[46] Barque Lizzie Bell shipwreck 24 Jul 1901 Waimate, Taranaki
7001120000000000000♠12[47] Cafe Chantant fire, The Octagon, Dunedin fire 8 Sep 1879 Dunedin
7001120000000000000♠12[48] ferry Pride of the Yarra and paddle steamer Favourite collision 6 Jul 1863 Otago Harbour
7001120000000000000♠12[49] L'Alcmène shipwreck 3 Jun 1851 Baylys Beach, Kaipara A French navy corvette
7001120000000000000♠12[50][51] Brigantine Rio Loge shipwreck (presumed) Jan 1909 Last seen in Cook Strait on 14 January, en route from Kaipara to Dunedin May have caused the wreck of the Penguin a month later.[52]
7001120000000000000♠12[53] Cyclone of 1936 storm 1 Feb 1936 North Island and upper South Island A tropical cyclone that originated near the Solomon Islands
7001110000000000000♠11[54] 2012 Carterton hot air balloon crash air accident 7 Jan 2012 near Carterton
7001110000000000000♠11[55] Glen Afton mine, carbon monoxide asphyxiation mine disaster 24 Sep 1939 Huntly
7001110000000000000♠11[56] B17 bomber crash air accident 12 Jun 1942 RNZAF Base Auckland at Whenuapai
7001100000000000000♠10[57] Aspiring Air Britten-Norman Islander, collided with terrain air crash 8 Aug 1989 Upper Dart Valley
7001100000000000000♠10[58] Brig Australia shipwreck 23 May 1873 off Cape Campbell
7001100000000000000♠10[59] Husky and Argo lost to storm in yacht race shipwrecks 21 Jan 1951 between Wellington and Christchurch
7001100000000000000♠10[60] sulphur mine destroyed lahar 10 Sep 1914 Whakaari/White Island
7001100000000000000♠10[61] Shamrock sailing boat shipwreck 1834 Queen Charlotte Sound Capsized and sank. Exact location unknown.

NOTE: The exact number of deaths in some early New Zealand shipwrecks is not fully recorded. There may be several shipwrecks not listed here which claimed ten or more lives.

Pandemics and health crises[edit]

Deaths Name or description Date Location Notes
7003860000000000000♠8,600 1918 flu pandemic 1918 October–December nationwide [62]
7002713000000000000♠713 HIV/AIDS pandemic 1983–ongoing nationwide As of December 2014.[63]
7001190000000000000♠19 2009 flu pandemic 2009 April–September nationwide

Significant incidents of New Zealanders being killed overseas[edit]

Confirmed Deaths Name Type Date Location Notes
7002470000000000000♠470[64] Cospatrick ship lost to fire 17 Nov 1874 640 km south-west of the Cape of Good Hope, en route to Auckland Only 3 people survived
7002100000000000000♠100[65] The Trevelyan (immigrant ship en route from Glasgow) storm 3 Jun 1888 Presumed foundered off the South African coast, en route to Port Chalmers, New Zealand
7001890000000000000♠89[66] Knowsley Hall shipwreck (presumed) 1879 between London and Lyttelton
7001790000000000000♠79[67] Matoaka shipwreck (presumed) 1869 between Lyttelton and London
7001100000000000000♠10[68] Bere Ferrers rail accident, train hit NZ troops on tracks by platform train accident 24 Sep 1917 Bere Ferrers, Devon, UK

References[edit]

  1. ^ Bateman New Zealand Encyclopedia, edition 4 (1995). Article: |earthquake 1931 Hawke's Bay earthquake, Hawke's Bay region, Napier
  2. ^ Welch, Denis (4 February 2006). "Shake, Rattle & Roll". New Zealand Listener (3430): 29–30.  A larger death toll of 258 includes two missing, presumed dead.
  3. ^ "List of deceased – Christchurch earthquake". New Zealand Police. 9 February 2012. Retrieved 24 February 2012. 
  4. ^ Waihi Landslide Archived 15 October 2011 at the Wayback Machine., GeoNet News, Vol. 2, February 2003, p. 7. Death toll calculated by subtracting death tolls for two later landslides (64 and 1 in 1846 and 1910 respectively) from the total of "more than 200" given for all three.
  5. ^ The eruption's death toll is uncertain. While 153 is a commonly quoted figure, only 108 named victims have been identified. Death list Archived 4 June 2008 at the Wayback Machine., Anheizen.com.
  6. ^ In 2007, the General Manager of the Earthquake Commission said that "... Ngati Hinemihi oral accounts put the death toll in the thousands." David Middleton (2007). A Roof Over Their Heads? The challenge of accommodation following disasters Archived 28 May 2008 at the Wayback Machine.. (Accessed 2008-04-12.)
